name: Easy C Movies Trivia Quiz | Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which 1993 comedy depicts the struggles of a Jamaican bobsledding team trying to make the Winter Olympics?
questions.explanation:
Cool Runnings.

	Irv Blitzer (John Candy) is a disgraced former double gold medalist.  Derice Bannock (Leon Robinson) failed to qualify for the Summer Olympics.  They join forces for another chance at Olympic glory in this movie, very loosely based on the Jamaican Bobsled team that participated in the 1988 Winter Olympics in Calgary. John Candy passed away in his sleep in 1994 at age 43 from a heart attack.  He had starred in 47 movies.

questions.text: What black-and-white movie of 1994 focuses on a day in the life of a store attendant, and introduces the characters of Jay and Silent Bob to the world?
questions.explanation:
Clerks.

	Dante Hicks (Brian O'Halloran) is not having a good day.  One of his ex-girlfriends has died, another is getting married, and his current girlfriend wants him to quit his job and go back to school.  To top it off, he is called into work on his day off, and then has to deal with annoying customers, drug dealers, his friend Randall in the video store next door, and trying to find someone to cover for him to go to his hockey game at 2pm. As well as starring in the movie, Kevin Smith was the writer, producer, director and editor of "Clerks".

questions.text: In which movie of 2000 does Violet Sanford dance on bar tops while working up the courage to be a songstress?
questions.explanation:
Coyote Ugly.

	Violet Sanford's (Piper Perabo) recording career is going nowhere. Desperately in need of money, she applies for a job at the bar "Coyote Ugly" and in doing so, overcomes numerous difficulties and finds her lost confidence and also love along the way. This movie was based on a real bar called Coyote Ugly in New York City.  Coyote Ugly now has a national chain of bars across the USA.

questions.text: Stephen Spielberg directed which 2002 movie, loosely based on the life of young con artist Frank Abagnale Jr.?
questions.explanation:
Catch Me If You Can.

	Having a hard time dealing with the breakup of his parents marriage, Frank Abagnale Jr. (Leonardo DiCaprio) runs away from home.  His ever escalating cons attract the attention of FBI agent Carl Hanratty (Tom Hanks), who pursues Frank across the globe. The real Frank Abagnale Jr. was captured in France in 1969. After his arrest, 26 different countries wanted to extradite him for fraud.  He ended up spending time in prison in France, Sweden and the US.  Ironically, he now runs a financial fraud consultancy company.

questions.text: Johnny Depp has a small role in which 2000 movie about a woman and her daughter moving to a small French town to open a store?
questions.explanation:
Chocolat.

	Vianne Rocher (Juliette Binoche) moves to a small traditional French town with her six-year-old daughter and opens a chocolate shop.  Opening the shop on Sundays incenses the local priest, but Vianne slowly wins over all the locals with her magical treats. Juliette Binoche is of Polish descent, and her maternal grandparents were incarcerated in the infamous Auschwitz.

questions.text: Sarah Michelle Gellar and Ryan Phillippe star in which 1999 movie as manipulative step-siblings?
questions.explanation:
Cruel Intentions.

	Based on the novel "Les Liaisons dangereuses", which has been adapted for film on several occasions, this movie follows the exploits of step-siblings Kathryn Merteuil (Gellar) and Sebastian Valmont (Phillippe) as they lie, cheat, manipulate and bed those around them.  In the end of course, they both have to pay for their actions. When Sarah Michelle Gellar was four years of age, she starred in an advertisement for Burger King which named and criticised their competitor McDonald's.  As a result, both she and Burger King were sued by McDonald's.  The case was settled when she was five years of age.

questions.text: Which Steven Spielberg directed movie of 1977 was one of the first to portray extraterrestrial beings in a positive light?
questions.correct: Close Encounters of the Third Kind
questions.explanation:
Close Encounters of the Third Kind.

	After sighting a UFO Roy Neary (Richard Dreyfuss) becomes obsessed with making models of a mountain he has never seen, driving his family away.  After seeing the mountain in a television broadcast, Roy, and others like him, head towards the site for a chance of a close encounter of the "third" kind. A close encounter of the first kind is sighting a UFO.  Of the second kind is a sighting with physical effects, eg. crop circles or electrical interference.  A close encounter of the third kind is physical contact with a UFO.  A close encounter of the fourth kind is abduction by a UFO.

questions.text: Tom Cruise and Bryan Brown star as charismatic bartenders in which movie of 1988?
questions.explanation:
Cocktail.

	Unable to find work and needing to earn money while he earns his degree, Brian Flanagan (Tom Cruise) takes a job as a bartender.  He is shown the tricks of the trade by the older, though not necessarily wiser, Doug Coughlin (Bryan Brown) and manages to find love along the way. Australian born Bryan Brown has been married to his wife Rachel Ward since 1983.  Although frequently working outside of Australia, he is known for being one of the few Aussie actors that keeps his Australian accent for the vast majority of the roles he plays.

questions.text: Which movie, released in 2002, stars Catherine Zeta Jones and Renee Zellweger as jazz singers?
questions.explanation:
Chicago.

	Based of course on the musical of the same name, "Chicago" follows Roxy Hart's (Zellweger) attempt to be acquitted of murder and make it as a famous jazz performer. Though it was widely rumoured, at the time Catherine Zeta Jones was not pregnant during the making of "Chicago".  She was, however, pregnant when she made the 2000 movie "Traffic" and the writers added her pregnancy into the script of that movie.

questions.text: Based on a Stephen King novel, which 1976 movie has one of the most memorable movie prom scenes?
questions.explanation:
Carrie.

	Raised by a disturbed mother and ostracised by her co-students, Carrie (Sissy Spacek) develops telekinetic powers.  On the night of the school prom, a cruel prank pushes her over the edge and she takes her revenge on the school and on her mother. "Carrie" was the first Stephen King novel to be turned into a movie, many others have followed with varying degrees of success.
